citation.article-title: Polyphasic taxonomic analysis of Bifidobacterium animalis and Bifidobacterium lactis reveals relatedness at the subspecies level: reclassification of Bifidobacterium animalis as Bifidobacterium animalis subsp. animalis subsp. nov. and Bifidobacterium lactis as Bifidobacterium animalis subsp. lactis subsp. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Strains display the following characteristics typical for the genus Bifidobacterium: Gram-positive, non-motile, non-spore forming, irregular rod-shaped anaerobes. Glucose is fermented using the characteristic enzyme fructose-6-phosphate phosphoketolase in the so-called Bifidus-shunt. Dextrin, Î±-d-glucose, maltose, maltotriose, d-raffinose and sucrose are fermented; starch is not fermented.
